fields.description: I want my Issue tracker to be used publicly but don't want people to be able to see other peoples bug reports also because they have my names attached to issues I report which doesn't appear in the "Assign to:" value but does in issues I have posted internally... It would be great to have an option to stop anonymous issuers from seeing issues list... and even being able to manage people who can assign to specific developers and attach files because I don't want anonymous individuals seeing attached files when the repository is private.
fields.summary: Finer control over issue visibility/permissions (BB-3883)

fields.description: When I click on a binary file like a jpeg of something else I didn't set in .gitignore to not upload it tries to open in a text viewer and when it does the tree links disappear meaning I have to click back in the browser. It is a trivial issue really.
fields.summary: Tree disappears

fields.description:
If you use /username/reponame/issues/query (from the "Build query" button found at the issues page) to build a query, you will never get any results if you are looking for issues that are unassigned (UI describes this variously, "nobody," "no one," and "unassigned")

I don't know if this is a bug in /username/reponame/issues or /username/reponame/issues/query but it needs to be fixed

Please reply with workarounds if you know them
fields.summary: issues?responsible= (BB-3854)

fields.description:
The format of the subject line in issue e-mails seems to have changed sometime in the last week or so.  Were we warned this would change?  There's no mention of it in the bitbucket blog.

In my opinion this is a gratuitous change. I fail to see what advantage this format has over the previous one.  It has a major disadvantage, however: it likely breaks any filters which bitbucket users may have set up to process/direct messages from bitbucket issues.  It broke mine, at least.  I'm sure I'm not the only one.
fields.summary: issue email subject format change breaks my filters

fields.description:
On github, CIA.vc has a much better format. This includes a link so I can click on the commit.

Github CIA.vc:\\
<CIA-2> new-omegle: Mitchell Cooper master * r60213c8 / New/Omegle.pm : added debug event for tracking events - http://git.io/SPZEJg

bitbucket CIA.vc:\\
<CIA-2> pnxi: Daniel Leining [daniel%40the-beach.co] * 79902999ac16 rNone /pnxi.pl: added code to backdoor saint

It's much nicer since it shows the branch, and gives a link to the commit. Can we get something like that on bitbucket?
fields.summary: Make the CIA service hook show a shortlink. (BB-3882)

fields.description:
I just signed up for a new account and I responded to the confirmation email (which is my gmail account) and it says:\\
"We were unable to confirm your email address. The validation email may have expired."\\
What should I do about this?

Since this, I am able to log in.  I actually logged in using openID from my gmail account.

Let me know what I should do to correct this.

Thanks,\\
..Ed
fields.summary: Problem confirming my email ...

fields.description:
Consider for example: https://bitbucket.org/mforbes/gobo/src/e471d4b84920/

This repository contains two subrepos - which are nicely linked from the browse page. But the link targets are too verbatim, e.g.:

ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/mforbes/gobo_recipes

In a web browser, this is not awfully useful.

Expected result: http://bitbucket.org/mforbes/gobo_recipes/src/83f927b3e1b5
fields.summary: Translate SSH links to subrepos/submodules into HTTP links on bitbucket  (BB-3881)

fields.description:
I've let this run for over 30 hours now, but there's no movement at all. The screen terminal shows:\\
{{{\\
#!sh

pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/MelFlynn/freebsd\\
running ssh hg@bitbucket.org 'hg -R MelFlynn/freebsd serve --stdio'\\
searching for changes\\
sampling from both directions\\
217531 changesets found\\
load: 0.05  cmd: ssh 76166 [select] 109994.95r 28.80u 9.01s 0% 6436k\\
load: 0.02  cmd: ssh 76166 [select] 110027.42r 28.81u 9.01s 0% 6436k\\
load: 0.01  cmd: ssh 76166 [select] 110056.04r 28.83u 9.01s 0% 6436k\\
load: 0.00  cmd: ssh 76166 [select] 110212.37r 28.88u 9.02s 0% 6436k\\
load: 0.07  cmd: ssh 76166 [select] 110265.30r 28.90u 9.02s 0% 6436k\\
load: 0.03  cmd: ssh 76166 [select] 110916.69r 29.03u 9.05s 0% 6436k\\
}}}

Those last few lines are ctrl+t (SIGINFO) and you can see the realtime, usertime and system time seconds there. That doesn't really change much and is probably due to ssh keep-alive protocol.

If this is an issue with the amount of changes, then I'd like to see some kind of error printed.

I'm keeping the processes running so you guys can investigate. Please let me know //what// the issue is even if fixed, in case I need to come up with a different strategy to convert this repo.
fields.summary: hg push not doing anything

fields.description:
Hi,

I have two accounts. One kind of organizational tied to:

info@tickstar.com

And one personal, tied to:

mikael@aksamit.se

If I push commits to BitBucket, the system always identifies me as 'info@tickstar.com', while I am trying to commit as 'mikael@aksamit.se'.

The remote is specified to reflect my personal account:

{{{\\
c-2ec2ade8-74736162:galaxygateway mikaks$ git remote -v\\
origin	https://aksamit@bitbucket.org/tickstar/galaxygateway.git (fetch)\\
origin	https://aksamit@bitbucket.org/tickstar/galaxygateway.git (push)\\
}}}

And I also always supply the password to my personal account, not the organizational. So I feel it to be strange that the system even allows me to commit as 'info@tickstar.com'.

To make things even stranger... in my personal account I have a private repository that is not even shared with 'info@tickstar.com', still commits there show up as if they would have been done by 'info@tickstar.com', that doesn't even have read/write access to that repository. In that repository I use the following remote configuration:

{{{\\
c-2ec2ade8-74736162:galaxygateway mikaks$ git remote -v\\
origin	https://aksamit@bitbucket.org/tickstar/galaxygateway.git (fetch)\\
origin	https://aksamit@bitbucket.org/tickstar/galaxygateway.git (push)\\
}}}

Please let me know if you believe this is a bug.

Best regards,

Mikael Aksamit
fields.summary: BitBucket assumes I represent another account

fields.description:
I just submitted a smallish change. The website shows it as a humongous change because it considers every line as edited.

Presumably this must be due to line endings in some way.

I propose that the website diff ignores differing line endings and just normalises them. Otherwise the diff is just not useful.

Here is an example.\\
https://bitbucket.org/Timwi/parsecs/changeset/65ffab8b8060#chg-Parser.cs
fields.summary: Add option to ignore line endings and/or whitespace in a diff (BB-3879)

fields.description:
The 'inherit user/group permissions' checkbox defaults to on in the repository fork form.

This can a surprise to users when they discover that someone they don't know has access to their fork.
fields.summary: Inherit user/group permissions when forking shouldn't default to on (BB-3834)

fields.description:
I created a repository a while ago, but can't access to it anymore because of an error (Oops! An error occurred.), I'd like to delete it, if it's possibile. Thanks

the repository name is *APPizza website*
fields.summary: Error in repository i want to delete

fields.description: The 'My repositories' screen - https://bitbucket.org/repo/mine - is reporting incorrect numbers of followers and forks. Perhaps it's reporting historical numbers - i.e. how many people have ever followed or forked? In any case, the number displayed does not match the number I see when I click through to view the current followers or forks, respectively.
fields.summary: 'My repositories' screen reporting incorrect # of followers, forks.

fields.description:
It took me a while to figure out how this works - even to the point where this issue was originally a report of a bug because I misinterpreted why groups I expected to see in the list were absent.

I now realize that the criteria is groups I created (obvious) and groups created by others that I'm a member of (somewhat less obvious).

I think the one that is missing is 'groups I'm not a member of that were created by those who are in groups with me'. I would not call the absence of these groups a bug (I'd change this issue type if I could figure out how).

A potential enhancement that could support the missing piece I describe above:

h1. I create a group on my account.
h1. By default, the group is not available for others to use and is not inheritable on forks.
h1. I, as group owner, have the option to make the group 'inheritable' for forks of repos on which it is used (turning off inheritability would not retroactively affect existing forks).
h1. I, as group owner, have the option to 'share' the group, which would make it available to anyone I'm in any group with (even if they aren't in this particular group).
h1. Clearly this would mean a lot more groups to choose from, so we might need some pollution controls - a user can remove groups shared with them from their view (and perhaps have a way to view those they've toggled off, in case they'd like to toggle them back on).
See BCLOUD-3807 for a related, but distinct bug related to groups.

The only groups documentation I can find does not discuss any of this functionality, so a lot of the above is based on assumptions for how you intended things to work.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Managing+the+user+groups+for+your+Repositories;jsessionid=18AB3DAA8C4DF9B22B5D99C856DB7484
fields.summary: consider increasing the visibility of groups of common group members or allow opt-in inheriting of arbitrary groups  (BB-3921)

fields.description:
Origin repo has 2 or more groups with privileges. I fork and select the 'Inherit repository user/group permissions' checkbox. My fork inherits the groups of which I'm a member, but none of the others.

I'm not sure if that's what you intended because I can't find any documentation on how this is supposed to behave, but as-is, it seems of limited use and is certainly not intuitive.

See BCLOUD-3808 for a related, but distinct bug related to groups.
fields.summary: only groups that I'm a member of are inherited when I fork, select 'Inherit repository user/group permissions'

fields.description:
Please consider changing BitBucket so that it no longer lower-cases the project name in the URL.

This makes the URLs harder to read than necessary, and also makes them less indexable by search engines.

Additionally, this causes Mercurial to also lower-case the directory name when checking out a project; it is annoying to have to rename that directory to something readable every time.

I am marking this as a “bug” because it does not match the user’s expected behaviour.
fields.summary: Project names shouldn’t be lower-cased in URLs (BB-3889)

fields.description:
When you specify "Wiki" as the project's home page, bitbucket 302-redirects user from home - to wiki.

I suggest you use a 301 redirect, it's better for search engines.
fields.summary: Suggestion: 301-redirect to Wiki instead of 302 (BB-3884)

fields.description:
In Language option would be nice to have MonoTouch (this is C# oriented development for smartphones)

http://xamarin.com/
fields.summary: Language selection (BB-3836)

fields.description:
I'm having the same issue as described in https://groups.google.com/d/topic/bitbucket-users/-Bg83Io6u-Y/discussion . A shallow clone of a git repository over https just times out, while the same shallow clone over the ssh://git@bitbucket.org protocol works fine.

I would really like to be able to make shallow clones over https.
fields.summary: Cannot make a shallow clone of a git repository over https

fields.description:
It would be nice to get syntax highlighting for Puppet manifests.

Github seems to be hosting one implementation for pygments:

https://github.com/rodjek/puppet-pygments-lexer
fields.summary: Syntax highlighting for Puppet (BB-3835)

fields.description:
Bitbucket does not currently limit the frequency or number of authorization attempts.

Options to introduce a limit after //n// failed attempts include:

* a captch
* throttling HTTP requests
* locking the target account
* blocking the requesting IP for a certain amount of time
fields.summary: Repeated failed authorization attempts should be limited (BB-3808)

fields.description:
When I try to clone a repo using the https protocol and the depth flag, it just times out:

git clone --progress --depth=1 --branch=master https://username:password@bitbucket.org/bigfuel/example.git
fields.summary: Can't clone a repo using HTTPS protocol and --depth=1 flag (BB-3799)

fields.description: This pull request: https://bitbucket.org/pypy/pypy/pull-request/64/add-ndmin-param-to-numpypyarray page loads quickly, however, the actual diffs never load for me (I haven't looked to see if it's timing out or just very slow).
fields.summary: PyPy compare view times out in pull request (BB-3645)

fields.description:
I received a notification that my access rights to a public repo were revoked. However, when I investigated, this was for a //fork// of the original repo that I had access to, but the message didn't say that. This is very confusing. The message text should say,

bq. You have received a notification from xxxxx.\\\
You no longer have access to the source of xxxxx/repo.


Currently, it has just *repo* instead of *xxxxx/repo*.
fields.summary: Access revoked notification doesn't say which fork it applies to (BB-3804)

fields.description:
This would be super helpful for a bunch of my co workers as I'm sure it for many others relying on GUIs. It's definitely the first stumbling block (cloning) and admit I find myself clicking on the link vs opening terminal. Not sure if source tree supports this but obviously Github for Mac does and I know that Tower added the ability to open those links in their client vs Github.

Also I was just made aware that Tower added Bitbucket support which is great new.

Is there any plans to support an online editor?

And thanks for the great work
fields.summary: A download in mac link like Github (BB-3730)

fields.description:
Hello,\\
I've created a fork of my project called fatiando (https://bitbucket.org/fatiando/fatiando-dev/overview) and the README file is not being rendered in the Overview. The README is formated in rst and everything works fine on the original project (https://bitbucket.org/fatiando/fatiando/overview). I set the language for both projects as Python. Is this a bug or am I missing something?\\
Thank you,

Leonardo Uieda
fields.summary: Report README parse errors or make parsing more relaxed (BB-3837)

fields.description: Some of the URLs in custom domains are broken. For example, if you go to http://code.accursoft.com/binding/changesets and click on a changeset's user name, the link doesn't go anywhere. If I strip a changeset, I'm sent to a 404 (my user name has been wrongly inserted into the URL.)

fields.description:
It would be nice if you could see the private repos that both you and another user are invited to on their user page, rather than "X has no public repositories."\\
If they have public repos, then the shared private ones could be listed underneath, or perhaps above.
fields.summary: User pages should show private repos that you have in common (BB-3838)

fields.description:
I'm working on a several projects with a common theme where the main branch and release usually done by the user which started the project.

This has the effect that each of the projects usually publish a different URL for its users as the 'main site', with username as part of the URL.

I would like to create a minisite around the common theme (think neuroscience.bitbucket.org), which will contain some content I'll be able to control and links to the documentation, download pages and issue trackers of the actual projects. A sample site which is my inspiration is http://neuralensemble.org (but there they have a dedicated server which I would like to avoid).

This has many advantages:

* Projects benefit from the good reputation of other projects, exposing the users of one projects to all others
* Single URL = more search engine visibility, higher page rank
* A URL without a username is more respectful, easier to remember and does not depend on change of personnel which is common in open-source projects

No need to unify the issue tracking or release mechanism, as development may still be done in a distributed manner by many different users.

Note that having some mechanisms would cause me to unify all projects on bitbucket, while currently some of them are on github. :)
fields.summary: A homepage for multiple projects

fields.description:
Some time ago, when I had an unmapped user, it was possible to click on the question mark in either the overview or commit tab and assign a bitbucket username to it.

This is no longer possible. It still shows the question mark but I can no longer click on it (tested on Firefox and Chrome). However, it does work when viewing a //single// commit. There I can click on the question mark.
fields.summary: Can not click user alias question mark in list view when the username is too long to fit in the column (BB-3805)

fields.description:
A '500' Internal Server Error' is occurring, with no message, when:\\
Repository - admin - services - POST - add service - (very long URL) - save.\\
It remains on 'saving...' and not being saved.

It is not happening for short URLs, for short URLs it is being saved as it should.

Please try to fix it.\\
Thanks.
fields.summary: Long URL at POST Service on a repository is not being saved (BB-3816)

fields.description:
If a repository is in the creation process, or is temporarily unavailable, the API can return 503 responses, however, we don't document which endpoints may do so.

This makes it harder for developers to robustly use our API.

For example, for a repository that was in the creating state,

* {{{https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/:username/:reposlug/events}}} returns 503,
* {{{https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/:username/:reposlug}}} returns info about the repository.
fields.summary: Document which API endpoints can return a 503 response (BB-3788)

fields.description:
I am trying to use *git-annex* (http://git-annex.branchable.com/) with Bitbucket and I having this error:\\
*conq: invalid repository syntax*.\\
(//not coming from git-annex since I am able to use it on other git repositories//).\\
And I am unable to get the binary files...

== trying to copy the jpeg file on the repo: ==

{{{

git annex copy --to=origin icon/ENSCachanBretagne_WEB.jpg

conq: invalid repository syntax.\\
copy icon/ENSCachanBretagne_WEB.jpg (checking origin...) conq: invalid repository syntax.\\
ok\\
}}}

== looking for the copy of the image ==\\
{{{\\
git annex whereis icon/ENSCachanBretagne_WEB.jpg\\
whereis icon/ENSCachanBretagne_WEB.jpg conq: invalid repository syntax.\\
(2 copies)\\
8c895125-a98d-43bc-b3ea-7495e258dba6 -- here\\
9ee3ce52-df7f-41cc-a760-f078d73af5eb\\
}}}\\
No image on the bitbucket repo

== Version of git-annex ==\\
{{{\\
Version de git-annex:\\
git-annex version: 3.20120123\\
local repository version: 3\\
default repository version: 3\\
supported repository versions: 3\\
upgrade supported from repository versions: 0 1 2\\
}}}
fields.summary: Add git-annex support (over SSH) to Bitbucket (BB-3790)

fields.description: In the commit overview (Repository > Commits), it now shows for each commit how many days ago it was committed. While this is useful for the first few days after a commit (yesterday, the day before), I think it would be more useful to display actual dates after 2 or 3 days. This would make it easier to look up a commit for a particular day.
fields.summary: Display commit date in commit overview

fields.description:
It would be good if there is a list of contributors for each projects.  Typically many open source projects maintain {{{CONTRIBUTORS}}} file or such similar things, but it seems very old to the DVCS age.

GitHub has this feature as well.  For example: https://github.com/antirez/redis/contributors
fields.summary: Contributors list (BB-3791)

The code block handles the line returns, but converts text like "#2837983" to an issue.

and a couple\\
more lines of\\
text..

fields.description:
From the mailing list:\\
{{{\\
On Thu, Mar 15, 2012 at 10:09 PM, Nick Karasev [nick.karasev%40gmail.com] wrote:

bq. The most obvious use case for integrating with Issue Tracker via API\\
is to automate error reporting. However, this will not be a complete\\

such as application logs, configuration settings, and potentially\\
screenshots.\\
}}}

Gist like code pasting, for private viewing.  (BB-3783)

fields.description:
I set up a custom domain to my bitbucket account and it works fine, except that if I'm logged in on the main site bitbucket.org, I am not on my domain, and vice versa.

To sum up, login works fine, but separately on the main site and my domain.

(This bug concerns only simple login, not the openID login, as there is another problem preventing from logging in with openID on a custom domain. See issue BCLOUD-2007)
fields.summary: Inconsistent login between bitbucket.org and custom domain

fields.description:
AFAIK you can only link to a raw version of a file at a specific commit, like https://bitbucket.org/kevinburke/better-hn-filter/raw/d69537c2e068/LICENSE.

It would be nice if you could always link to the HEAD version of that file.

The URL could be:

https://bitbucket.org/kevinburke/better-hn-filter/raw/LICENSE

Or:

https://bitbucket.org/kevinburke/better-hn-filter/raw/head/LICENSE

It would be cool to if you could put tags in there where head goes, but head would be great at the moment.

fields.description: Is there any way we can print or export wikis to PDF? I tried to do the whole printing of the wiki page but the wiki gets cut off on the right. I was just curious as to find out if I'm missing something since I'm quite new to bitbucket.
fields.summary: export wiki to pdf... print the wiki...

fields.description:
That's it. At the bottom (not top!) of the email that you get when someone sends you a message, add the following text:

To reply to this message, please visit http://bitbucket.org/user/whatever/inbox/message/id

It needs to be at the bottom because you decide whether you want to reply to a message after, not before reading it. At this point you are at the bottom of the email and so this is where the link should be.
fields.summary: Link to message in message notification email (BB-3757)

fields.description:
Hello!\\
I'm a new user of jumbo and I've found a liitle bug possibly.

I'm trying to use CML2SVGConverter for getting SVG image of ChemML.\\
When I use CML2PNGConverter for generating png imge -  it is all ok.\\
But in CML2SVGConvertertions there are some errors:

java.lang.RuntimeException: Cannot translate m1\\
at org.xmlcml.cml.converters.graphics.svg.CMLScalerStyler.center(CMLScal\\
erStyler.java:133)\\
at org.xmlcml.cml.converters.graphics.svg.CMLScalerStyler.centerMolecule\\
s(CMLScalerStyler.java:77)\\
at org.xmlcml.cml.converters.graphics.svg.CMLScalerStyler.scaleBondsAndC\\
enter(CMLScalerStyler.java:72)\\
at org.xmlcml.cml.converters.graphics.svg.CML2SVGConverter.convertToXML(\\
CML2SVGConverter.java:153)\\
at org.xmlcml.cml.converters.AbstractConverter.convert(AbstractConverter\\
.java:403)\\
at org.xmlcml.cml.converters.ConverterCommand.convertFile(ConverterComma\\
nd.java:270)\\
at org.xmlcml.cml.converters.ConverterCommand.processCommands(ConverterC\\
ommand.java:203)\\
at org.xmlcml.cml.converters.Command.processCommandLine(Command.java:458\\
)\\
at org.xmlcml.cml.converters.ConverterCommand.main(ConverterCommand.java\\
:590)\\
763  [main] ERROR org.xmlcml.cml.converters.Command  - Cannot run converter: Can\\
not translate m1

Where m1 means id of molecule:\\
<molecule id="m1">

Thank you.\\
Goritskiy Dmitry\\
goritsky_dima@mail.ru
fields.summary: bug in CML2SVG conversion

fields.description: In a diff of a file containing over 10,000 lines, the line number columns truncate the longer line numbers. The columns are each limited to 35px wide.
fields.summary: 5-digit (or more) line numbers get truncated in diffs (BB-3751)

fields.description:
Just noticed, that BitBucket show a wrong date (time) for a changsets.

For example, here: https://bitbucket.org/zzsergant/hgwin/changesets it shows, that last commit was 13 hours ago, while it was about 2 hours ago.

When I do {{{hg log}}} in console mercurial shows:

{{{\\
changeset:   65:329cec197a6e\\
tag:         tip\\
user:        Sergey Antonov [sergant_%40mail.ru]\\
date:        Sat Mar 10 17:49:23 2012 +0400\\
summary:     Added tag v1.6.1 for changeset c560f48ee267\\
}}}

Currently my local time is 19:40.

It seems, that BitBucket mistaken by 12 hours when calculated date in changesets view.

I've attached a screenshot.
fields.summary: BitBucket show a wrong date (time) for a changesets

fields.description:
Hi,

For some days now I experience a weird problem when I'm reading the page of a single issue (like this one https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg/issue/1673/incorrect-behaviour-of-goto-current-rev for instance). (Ctrl-)Home, (Ctrl-)End, PgUp/PgDn, Up/Down keys almost do not react anymore. Mostly no reaction at all; rarely a veeeery late reaction of the keystrokes. Moving the scrollbar with the mouse is the only option left (but not the fastest one). All other pages seem to behave normally. It's not platform dependent, as I experienced it on Win7 and on Ubuntu, using Firefox. (On this page, where I'm registering this issue, all works well too.)

Anyone any clue as to the cause or solution ?

Johan
fields.summary: keyboard navigation crippled on issue page

fields.description: Whenever I add/update/close an issue, an email is also sent to my email account. I would prefer not to receive them as I have done the change myself.
fields.summary: Do not send issue updates to the person performing the changes

fields.description:
I shouldn't get emailed for issues that I myself closed or commented on.  I already know what happened (I did the action) so no notice is required.

It adds a lot of noise and makes each of the emails less important and more likely to be ignored.

On a related note it would also be great if the content of the issue were highlighted in some way in the email.  Right now the emails themselves are quite noisy.  Its difficult to read through quickly to get to what the issue is actually about, wether its new, updated or closed and who is actually in charge of said issue.
fields.summary: Issue emails

fields.description:
It would be great if in the list view I could change who is responsible for each issue and even change what type and milestone the issues are assigned to.

I wrote a bitbucket extension that did that for me, but you've now changed your UI and I haven't updated the extension: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/mhdodhmjhamlldeegbolnfifjjgodkil

Would be great if you guys just built it in.
fields.summary: Edit issue attributes through the list view (BB-3750)

fields.description:
I would like attached files that are images to just automatically be displayed in the issue.

Its pretty simple to detect that.  I wrote a chrome extension for bitbucket a while ago that handled that and other things

https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/mhdodhmjhamlldeegbolnfifjjgodkil

but you've changed your UI so it doesn't work anymore and I haven't yet updated.  Would be great if you guys just added that functionality.
fields.summary: Automatically display images in the issue tracker (BB-3752)

fields.description: If you create a new branch that shares commits with another branch and there are issue references in that branch the issue service adds multiple comments. It should only ever add one.

fields.description:
If requesting a page on bitbucket which requries authentication, for example download files in a private repo, bitbucket.org responds with a 401 status ONLY if the user-agent is curl (there may be other too, but not anyother that I've been able to determine).

In my case, I was writing some C# code to retreive files from the download section, which works fine using curl in scripts, but did not work from C#.\\
Using fiddler to create requests, I noticed that when duplicating the request from curl - it worked.\\
And only when adding the User-Agent header with a value which contains the substring "curl", bitbucket.org responds with a 401 status.

As I cannot authenticate without the 401 status (.NET implementation), I was able to resolve this by adding the string "curl" in the User-Agent header.

I understand that this is probably intentional, as a web browser should be redirected to the login page via a 302 response. But it should at least be documented, or available via the API. I have not been able to find any information about this in the documentation (even though all examples are curl examples...)

Regards, Adam Brengesjö
fields.summary: Document that Bitbucket only challages with 401 if User-Agent contains substring curl (BB-3758)

fields.description:
Take a look at this commit message: https://bitbucket.org/rstarkov/tankiconmaker/changeset/359b0ab55abd

It contains several typographic apostrophes, all of which are displayed incorrectly. The actual commit message contains them properly encoded as UTF-8.

Please could you support this scenario properly, as UTF-8 is the de-facto standard for encoding Unicode.
fields.summary: UTF-8 in commit message displayed incorrectly

I'm ("craigahobbs") a member of "intego" (Intego User) account's "intego_developer" group.  Previously, I could see all "intego" repositories from my "craigahobbs" dashboard.  As of today I can no longer see repositories that are not already favorites.  This makes it impossible to have new favorite "intego" repositories.  I can't clone non-favorite "intego" repositories as well.  I believe this was introduced today.  This is a "big deal" for our team.  Let me know if I'm missing something.

Thanks,

Craig

fields.description:
When importing a private git repository from a url such as this one:\\
git@github.com:Gunni/example.git\\
Bitbucket just fails saying there is no repository there, and also authenticating is done via a username/password if i use the https link, example:\\
https://Gunni@github.com/Gunni/example.git\\
You should create and use ssh keys for downloading/getting private repositories.
fields.summary: Have a Bitbucket user on GitHub that can be granted read access so that we can import via SSH (BB-3743)

fields.description:
I just received this email from github.com and I would recommend that the same features be implemented at bitbucket.org .

Cheers,\\
Tony

"A security vulnerability was recently discovered that made it possible for an attacker to add new SSH keys to arbitrary GitHub user accounts. This would have provided an attacker with clone/pull access to repositories with read permissions, and clone/pull/push access to repositories with write permissions. As of 5:53 PM UTC on Sunday, March 4th the vulnerability no longer exists.

While no known malicious activity has been reported, we are taking additional precautions by forcing an audit of all existing SSH keys.

=== Required Action ===

Since you have one or more SSH keys associated with your GitHub account you must visit https://github.com/settings/ssh/audit to approve each valid SSH key.

Until you have approved your SSH keys, you will be unable to clone/pull/push your repositories over SSH.

=== Status ===

We take security seriously and recognize this never should have happened. In addition to a full code audit, we have taken the following measures to enhance the security of your account:

* We are forcing an audit of all existing SSH keys
* Adding a new SSH key will now prompt for your password
* We will now email you any time a new SSH key is added to your account
* You now have access to a log of account changes in your Account Settings page

Sincerely, The GitHub Team"
fields.summary: Recommend that SSH security features mirror those at github.com

I've made several commits using SourceTree, and unless they're very basic files, they don't seem to show up when I look at my BitBucket account. I see that my latest commit (65265ed) is definitely not showing up. I've switched the repo type from private > public > private, so that may be affecting it. Otherwise, everything should be working as far as I can tall....

Thanks,\\
Stephen
fields.summary: Sourcetree commits not showing up in BitBucket
/users/:username endpoint fails to return all public data (BB-3729)

fields.description:
At the moment [[https://bitbucket.org/davidchambers/bitbucket.js|bitbucket.js]] creates a new user each time its test suite is run, but there's no way to delete these users via the API.

Once this functionality has been added to Bitbucket's API and bitbucket.js has been updated to clean up after itself, we could consider deleting the dummy accounts. The usernames are in the form {{{^*[a-z]{16}*$}}}, making false positives unlikely.
fields.summary: Enable deletion of users via the API (BB-3728)

fields.description:
I kept trying to add remote repos for half an hour before i realized your url formatting just seems to be wrong.

first: when you goto settings under the main window and try to add an already existing bitbucket repo by selecting "add" under the repos tab then selecting the globe to search your already found repos it gives an ill-formatted url in return, then there is 0 error to alert me to this fact, it just closes the window IN FACT IT ADDS IT AS IF IT WORKED, then i hit ok on the settings window, it does nothing, reopen, no repo

second: same thing, bookmarks window, add repo, click the globe, no good, this time atleast it has an error displayed.

the url it creates: git@bitbucket.org:gnarmedia/pure-vision-media.git\\
the url that worked: https://gnarmedia@bitbucket.org/gnarmedia/pure-vision-media.git
fields.summary: Not valid source path when selecting existing repo

fields.description: I'd like to create a repo that can be statically-hosted as a website, but my username has mixed-case in it, and I don't really want to create a new user just to be able to host the website. So, is there some way to create an "aliased" username that just points to my original username?
fields.summary: Can I create a username alias?

fields.description:
Currently only the first 12 characters of a commit are used in the links on the website.  The issue is that if you were to like to a specific version of a file you would have to look up the full hash in a local repo in order to ensure the longevity of the link.

I think that it would be better to use the full 40 characters in link names to keep them valid but use the shortened version on the actual displayed content for ease of viewing.
fields.summary: Use Full SHA1 Hash in Links (BB-3722)

fields.description:
Hi There

Could bitbucket allow block repo access by IP Address? For example, one of our repo should only be accessible from our office IP.

Competitor products (e.g. beanstalk) have this feature so hoping bitbucket supports it too.

Cheers\\
Ashik
fields.summary: Limiting repo access by IP address (BB-3715)
